chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Christopher J Shepherd was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Christopher J Shepherd was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: Count 2, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

supervisions.notes: Fine, DNA surcharge and Blood draw fee are to be paid at the rate of $50 per month commencing 07-01-2016 and the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full or serve 30 days jail with huber, consecutive as penalty for failure to pay.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Oconomowoc Police Department.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

FIRST 49 DAYS:  Huber with standard release conditions.
Defendant to report to the Huber facility no later than 06:00 p.m. on 05-02-2016.
Balance to be served through the Day Report Program.
Good time credit applies to all 90 days.
Apply 1 day sentence credit.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: Day Report Center Direct Court Notification Report; Defendant successfully completed program.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
  Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.
notification report, non-compliance, filed by Wisconsin Community Services, Day Report Center.

Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 04/25/16.
Defendant received a copy of the order in court.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Christopher J Shepherd in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
120 Days in the Waukesha County - Straight-Time.
Consecutive to:  Count 2.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  9 Months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.





Count 2:
90 Days  in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
1  Day Credit.
Good time credit applies to all 90 days.
First 49 days to be served at the Huber Facility -Balance to be served through the Day Report Program.
Defendant to report to the huber facility no later than 6 pm on:  05/02/16

FINE: $ 1,179
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Town of Oconomowoc Police Department.
To be paid at the rate of $50 per month, starting 07/01/16 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: 30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions) - Consecutive.

15 Months D/L REVOCATION
15 Months IGNITION INTERLOCK


Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.    

Court Grants and signed order for half-price ignition interlock.
Defendant received a copy of the order in court.
